@ JohnWu:

Your torrent must be missing either the Stuff Packs either the Expansion Packs. Also it is possible that it uses 7-z compression type.

Given that all the Expansions together are about 35-45 GB in total, and all the Stuff Packs are about 15-25 GB total, your torrent must be missing either some files, either build differently.

The torrent I post here, gives you a Sims 3 game that is 100% friendly to any future updates/game patches, and allows you to sign in with the Game Launcher and enjoy all online features (such as the store, content sharing, SimPort, etc, without any penalties for your account (if you have any).

Enjoy!

In case someone here is wondering, the Sims 3 Game Launcher is absolutely safe to use, and can connect online with the www.Sims3.com and the Store. All online in-game features such as the SimPort, the Store, the Messaging, etc, work perfectly in the game.

I talked to a friend about your No Disk error, and he believes that you have let the game's setup installer to install the EA Download Manager (aka Origin). Have you?
lanie225, remember that the installation of EA's Download Manager (aka Origin) must be avoided at ANY cost.  The Readme makes this rule clear for a successful installation of the game.
